newsitem.title: ESTONIA: LEKS HOPES FOR BOURSE LISTING EARLY SUMMER.
newsitem.headline: LEKS HOPES FOR BOURSE LISTING EARLY SUMMER.

text.p: Insurance company Leks hopes to list its shares on the secondary list of the Tallinn stock exchange early in the summer, the company said on Wednesday.
Leks will take its shares to the bourse after it has increased its share capital by four million kroons to 42 million kroons, finance director Aarne Orav told Reuters.
Leks is to make a closed issue of 2.1 million kroons of its shares to major shareholder Tallinna Pank and will make another 1.9 million shares available in a public offer.
Tallinna Pank is to buy the Leks shares on April 21 or on the same date the public offer starts, Orav added.
He confirmed newspaper reports earlier this week that the share price in both issues is 38 kroons for a 10-kroon face value share.
Leks hopes to get a licence from the Tallinn stock exchange to have its shares quoted early summer, Orav added.
Tallinna Pank owns 52 percent of Leks' shares.
